subject: Critical Thinking
title: Medical Ethics: Triage and Impossible Choices
description: One-minute skill: Medical Ethics: Triage and Impossible Choices.

hook.text: COVID-19: one ventilator, two patients. One is 30, otherwise healthy. The other is 70 with heart disease.

buildup.text: Medical triage: allocating scarce resources when not everyone can be saved.

discovery.text: Common triage principles: save the most lives, save the most life-years, first-come first-served, random lottery, or.

twist.text: Each principle has moral trade-offs. 'Most life-years' discriminates against the elderly.

climax.text: The lesson: ethical frameworks don't eliminate tragic choices.

punchline.text: The choice isn't between right & wrong. It's between wrong & worse.

quiz.question: Why is medical triage ethically difficult?
options: Every allocation principle has moral trade-offs; no principle avoids all unfairness
